column4: anybody? this should be a trivial task. i've tried both a regular application launch and an application in terminal launcher, neither work
I am just trying to figure out how to launch a shell script from an app launcher in gnome
i've tried launchers, using "sh <path to script>", gnome-terminal -e, nothing works (i'm trying to launch my java IDE, intellij IDEA)
just executing it from a term works fine
does just NOTHING happen?  if so, what is placed in .xsession-errors?
if i configure the launch as a terminal launcher, i see some window pop up and disappear immediately
if i configure the launch as an "Application", nothing happens when i click the icon (other than the animation for opening an app)
what happens if you run "gnome-terminal -e SCRIPTNAME" from a console?
the same thing that happens if i run it from the alt+f2 run dialog: a terminal window with a modal error stating "there was an error craeting the child process for this terminal"
can you put the output of "mount" in a pastebin, please
odd... that error is usually from a lack of a proper /dev filesystem... what are permissions on /dev/null?
